revised_title: Experimental Evidence of Light and Magnetism Connection
tldr: Faraday discovered that a polarized light ray can be magnetized and electrified when passing through a magnetic field. He used a heavy glass called silicated borate of lead to demonstrate this phenomenon. The rotation of the light ray depends on the direction of the magnetic field and the position of the glass relative to the magnetic poles. This finding showed a direct connection between light and magnetism, paving the way for the study of electromagnetism.
